requests.name: Available endpoints
requests.description: The root endpoint will provide you a JSON Swagger definition.

requests.name: Get a list of supported formats
requests.description: Get a list of supported formats for documents, style guides and extensions.

requests.name: Download the global glossary.
requests.description: Download your corporate account's global glossary. This endpoint is available only for corporate account customers.

requests.name: Create or update the global glossary.
requests.description: Update your corporate account's global glossary. This endpoint is available only for corporate account customers.

requests.name: Get a list of supported languages
requests.description: Get a list of supported languages

requests.name: Get your account information and summary.
Get a list of your projects
requests.description: Get a list of your projects

requests.name: Get a new quote
requests.description: Create a new project

queryParams.description: Optional. If you provide a callback URL, we will send POST callbacks when the status of the current project is changed. Possible status changes are, 'translated', 'proofread', 'completed'.

Optional. This is a consistent custom data parameter that will be given to you in the response across every request of this project model. Values should be provided like this, custom[my_key] = my_value.
Optional. You can add as many files as you want in documents[] parameter. Or you add your documents later in separate calls.
Optional. You can add as many files as you want in styleguides[] parameter. Or you add your style guides later in separate calls.
Optional. Only one glossary is supported at the moment.

requests.name: Delete a project
requests.description: Delete(cancel) a project.

requests.name: Get single project
requests.description: Get single project

requests.name: Update project language pairs
requests.description: Update project language pairs

queryParams.description: Optional. If you provide a callback URL, we will send POST callbacks when the status of the current project is changed. Possible status changes are, 'translated', 'proofread', 'completed'.

Optional. This is a consistent custom data parameter that will be given to you in the response across every request of this project model. Values should be provided like this, custom[my_key] = my_value.

requests.name: Trigger a call to your callback URL related to this project.
requests.description: Trigger a call to your callback URL related to this project.

requests.name: Download the latest translation package.
requests.description: Download the latest translation package. You must have given a /package call beforehand and wait until the packaging status is 'completed'.

requests.name: Download the latest translation package.
requests.description: Download only the translation package of this language. You must have given a /package call beforehand and wait until the packaging status is 'completed'.

queryParams.description: Language code. You can download the translation of only a specific language.
Optional. Determines which method to use for payment. Options are 'corporate', 'client'.
Optional. According to your corporate account configuration, this may be required.
Optional with corporate accounts. Not available for others.

requests.name: Package the translation of all languages to be downloaded.
requests.description: Package the translation project, make it ready to be downloaded.

queryParams.description: If you want to package and download the translation synchronously, mark this parameter as '0'. It will package the translation and then return the packaged file in the response, identical to /download call after an asynchronous /package call.

requests.name: Track the status of translation packaging.
requests.description: This request will tell you the current progress of the translation packaging. You will use the 'key' provided by the /package call.

queryParams.description: This is the package tracking key provided in the response of a /package call.

requests.name: Package the translation of a specific target language to be downloaded.
requests.description: Package the translation project, make it ready to be downloaded.

queryParams.description: Language code. You can download the translation of only a specific language.

If you want to package and download the translation synchronously, mark this parameter as '0'. It will package the translation and then return the packaged file in the response, identical to /download call after an asynchronous /package call.

requests.name: Get project progress
requests.description: Get the progress of an already launched project.

requests.name: Get a list of realtime activities.
requests.description: Get a list of realtime activities on the project, such as translation suggestion and translation approval.

requests.name: Get a single realtime activity.
requests.description: Get a single realtime activity.

requests.name: Submit a comment to an activity.
requests.description: Submit a comment to an activity.

requests.name: Get a list of comments belonging to this activity.
requests.description: Get a list of comments belonging to this activity.

requests.name: Get a list of activity comments throughout the whole project.
requests.description: Get a list of activity comments throughout the whole project.

requests.name: Get a list of documents
requests.description: Get a list of documents

requests.name: Upload a new document
requests.description: Upload a new document

queryParams.description: Optional. You can add as many files as you want in documents[] parameter. Or you add your documents later in separate calls.

JSON string. If your documents have a scheme, as in cases of CSV files, use the same array index keys for `schemes` parameter to specify their schemes. See `Document Schemes` title in the API documentation.

requests.name: Delete the document
requests.description: Delete the document

requests.name: Get single document
requests.description: Get single document

requests.name: Update the document.
requests.description: Update the document. File name and contents will replaced with the new one.

queryParams.description: Single file data. The name is plural to provide a consistent naming convention.

JSON string. If your documents have a scheme, as in cases of CSV files, use the same array index keys for `schemes` parameter to specify their schemes. See `Document Schemes` title in the API documentation.

requests.description: Download a document

requests.description: Get a list of glossaries

requests.name: Download the global style guide.
requests.description: Download your corporate account's global style guide. This endpoint is available only for corporate account customers.

requests.name: Create or update the global style guide.
requests.description: Update your corporate account's global style guide. This endpoint is available only for corporate account customers.

queryParams.description: Style guide file. Currently supported formats: .pdf, .docx, .txt

requests.name: Retrieve an access token to interact with the API.
requests.description: MotaWord API is using OAuth2 procedures when authenticating or authorizing your API call. Currently, we only allow Client Credential type flow.

queryParams.description: OAuth2 grant type. Currently only 'client_credentials' available.
